Posted By: Llandner (12/3/2009 8:45:19 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
there is a very simple reason why this card is not (collectively) rated higher. it is the same reason super powerful cards like BSA and Jace 2.0 aren't rated near the top even though they are excellent cards. the reason is because angry people low-rate these good cards because they are envious that they cannot afford to play with them. They think that every card good card should be accessible to all players...nevermind that completely contradicts the 'collectible' part of this collectible card game.
  
   
for the record, I do not have $2K to spend on a piece of cardboard, but I still give it a 5/5 because that is what it deserves :)

posts.post_content:
I would say that half the people on this thread, are either trolling, stupid to the point of brain damage, or simply like to feel superior and thus will badmouth anything they have no chance of either obtaining or understanding.  
  
Sad, really. But hey, it means amusement for the rest of us.  
  
Black Lotus is a utility card. Plain and simple. It provides you three mana of any one color as early as turn one, and there are what must be, like, dozens of ways to win that first turn, if you have this utility card in a deck worth its salt. Yes, some people say "you need a good deck to use it though!!1eleven! But the point is, THAT'S HOW ANY DECK WORKS. God, people. There is no such thing as an invincible card. Even in the B.L.'s case, you need it turn one or two, and you need to be competent to not only build a deck that can utilize it, but also to have the brains to comprehend what you're trying to do. I admit, not a lot of people can really do that, and I don't know if that's good or bad for ... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
I like the fact that they tried to create a [more balanced version](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?multiverseid=114904) of this. I think Lotus Bloom is a useful card actually, although the delay will make it rather useless if you don't draw it early.   
Therefore Black Lotus still overshadows this one by far - and it should, since any card getting near the awesomeness of it is quite broken.

posts.post_content:
People are either rating this 5 Stars for sheer broken power, or they're rating it much lower for 'badly Designed- ergo not fun- ergo not "good" as I define good which includes more than win-probability increase power"  
  
Actually, after looking a lot at Vintage lists, there are some cards that I would expect to see WAY more often in decklists, and yet don't have the ubiquity their reputation suggests they should. Black Lotus is just such one of these cards, and while it's \*potential\* is simply screamingly powerful, it \*looks\* like the Vintage players of today don't just slam it in lists because they own it- Oh they DO run it, a lot, but also, I've seen WINNING decklists for Vintage that use mana and do not use Black Lotus- why not then?  
  
[Chalice of the Void](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chalice of the Void) is an Anti-0 cost Hate Tech in Vintage. I don't think it's the explanation, but I mention that card more as a question than a statement- do that, Null Rod and other hate really account for anything less than 100%... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)

posts.post_content:
Q: What's the difference between a Black Lotus and a pile of dead babies?  
A: I don't own a Black Lotus.  
  
Q: What's the difference between a Black Lotus and a black man?  
A: When you tap a Black Lotus, you get three mana. When you tap a black man, you get shot.  
  
Q: What's the difference between Black Lotuses and fat women?  
A: I'd rather f-uck a Black Lotus.  
  
Q: What does a black scientist and a Black Lotus have in common?  
A: They are both very rare.

posts.post_content:
Imagine black lotus in a word with 0 card draw and 0 tutors. This becomes a giant 2 for 1 engine. I always get excited when someone drops a black lotus in MTG tactics, thinking 2 for 1.  
  
And I rate on balance, the Power 9 were impossible to beat unless u had the power 9. Kinda destroyed the point of this complex card game that had all these creatures and whatnot.  
  
.5/5
